intro: Pleuradena, commonly known as the rock daisy, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Rutaceae. These plants are native to Australia and are characterized by their showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in shades of yellow, orange, and red. Pleuradena species typically grow in rocky or sandy soils and are adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. They have small, often hairy leaves and produce fruit that is a capsule containing numerous seeds. The genus includes several species, some of which are cultivated for their ornamental value in gardens.
